body:
I agree that gc's current behavior of treating "x *= 2 / 3" like "x = x * (2 / 3)" seems correct/intuitive, but does the spec actually explain that unambiguously?  I don't see anything that rules out @cznic's expectation that it should have instead behaved like "x = (x * 2) / 3".

The simplest fix seems to be to clarify that "x op= y" is equivalent to "x = x op (y)".
